reviews.text: We stayed at the Rigihof for 1 night during August 2005. This hotel is wonderful. It is right by a tram stop in a quiet area of Zurich, about a 2-3min tram ride into the centre of things. The receptionists were helpful, nice and even gave us a welcome drink. We walked in looking a mess after an early morning and with some huge rucksacks, and the staff treated us exactly like the polished couple next to us.
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel!
First class hotel...
reviews.text: The room was light, spacious and airy. We even had a balcony overlooking some pretty apartments. This hotel really did think of everything. In the wardrobe, there was an umbrella for use free of charge which you could also purchase at the end of your stay if you wished. There were slippers, a rubber duck in the bathroom, huge jars of soap, a reasonably priced mini bar, sweeties, everything you wanted really. The hotel info booklet was very very comprehensive, and there was lots of info on Zurich.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Was surprised by this hotel actually. It was very stylish - especially if you're into Bauhaus. Room was clean, and stocked full of bathroom supplies... including a duckie for the bathtub, which was a funny touch. We had large balconies on both of the rooms we booked, and it looked like every room had a similar balcony on our side of the hotel (facing the back). The breakfast was very nice - especially for a buffet-style hotel breakfast. The hotel is pretty far from the old town/train station - but there's trams right outside the front door that can take you there. The neighborhood seemed pretty quiet, and after 8pm most things were closed except for the restaurant next door. So if you want to go out, be prepared to take the tram or a cab. Really enjoyed our stay though.
reviews.title: Suprised - great hotel

likes.disliked: — Expensive pay-as-you-go wireless access in the rooms.

reviews.text: Just one night in this lovely Bauhaus hotel less than 10 minutes far from the center, a real pity! Each room is dedicated to some representative person in Switzerland: I am a chemist and I am in the Chemist room! Ah, Life is strange! The room is not so spacious (I asked for a single room), but there is a wide balcony. Everything is perfectly clean and devoted to details. Staff is extremely friendly, and the restaurant is gorgeous. I spent about 130 euro for one single room breakfast included and welcome drink... absolutely honest if compared to Zurich standards. Don't miss it!!
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed for 3 days at Hotel Rigihof and it was a pleasant stay.
reviews.title: Nice,cozy hotel!

reviews.text: The room was spacious and clean. I asked for one at the back , as I had read the reviews saying that the rooms in front face the central road which is noisy. The truth is that the road didn't seem so central and noisy to me. Zurich is a peaceful city. There was also a tram STOP outside the hotel ,which is something I look for when choosing the right hotel. The variety at the breakfast was average but you could also order an omelette or waffle if you wanted. The receptionists were polite and the housekeepers left lollipops on our pillows every morning. Maybe because of the Euro 2008. Lastly, the painting on the wall was a pretty detail in the room, as also the magazines on the desk. If I visit Zurich again, I will definitely stay at Rigihof again.
reviews.title: OK hotel marred by noisy location

reviews.text: We have just spent a night at the Rigihof. Receptionists were helpful & charming, greeting us with a glass of wine on arrival. Our 2 double rooms however were small, very noisy with a tram running outside the window till late at night, had no dressing table or comfortable chair & a bedside light was broken. The double bed had a single duvet which needed replacing late in the evening. The bathroom was miniscule & very poorly lit & the shower was ancient & difficult to work. This 4* hotel was a great disappointment & spoilt the enjoyment of our first trip to Zurich.
reviews.title: Good reception, very disappointing rooms

reviews.text: We just stayed at the Rigihof for two nights 29/04 - 1/05. It was in a very convenient location from the main rail station ('Hauptbahnhof or HB when you are buying tickets at the airport), with it being a teeny tiny walk from Winkelriedstrasse tram stop (lines 9/10).
reviews.title: Rigihof Has The Right Stuff

reviews.text: The room was light and airy with windows that opened up to let in some cool refreshing air. The washroom was spotless with great toiletries and a perfectly powerful shower!
reviews.title: Great find

reviews.text: The explanation of which room you were in, with a written hisptory and the headboard of art made it such a unique atmosphere. The bed was soft and comfortable. I think we lucked out because we didn't get the two twins shoved together.
reviews.title: Good hotel, but watch out for hot summer days...

reviews.text: The staff on reception were very friendly and helpful. They fielded all of our questions, even if we didn't really ask them clearly.
reviews.title: Was disappointed...very noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You know that at the Leonardo Rigihof that you're not staying in a bland 3/4* Holiday Inn, Mercure or Hilton. The hotel exterior is Bauhaus style and, with all credit to the management, the style is carried on low-key throughout the hotel. The individual room motifs based on local famous people, is an excellent idea. The hotel probably needs a little investment now to refresh it, but it's still fine by us. Breakfast was very good, with hot options cooked to order. Rooms at rear were generally quieter than front - though, even at rear, you must expect some noise - deliveries, waste collections - Zurich is an "early to work" city.
reviews.title: Recommended - not your bland branded hotel!

reviews.text: We bought a 72hr "go anywhere" ZurichCARD - Trams (Airport direct to Hotel, Hotel to Town), Train (HB to Uetliberg), Trip on Lake, Trip on Limmat, Entrance to Kunsthaus.... all included. A Bargain!
reviews.title: Couldn't be noisier

reviews.text: Would definitely stay at the Rigihof again.
reviews.title: Central to all activities, including City Centre and Financial Area
Not so central and Closer to a 3 star than a 4
reviews.text: The hotel is clean, modern and the staff are very friendly. However, the hotel is on a busy road that includes streetcars going by every few minutes. It is also close to the university hospital so there's a good share of ambulances with sirens whizzing by, and finally, there was construction on a nearby road that added to the noise. Unfortunately, the hotel (or at least my room) does not have air conditioning which meant you needed the windows open otherwise you'd melt. Not what I expected.
